text: This study explores the complex dynamics between Emotional Intelligence (EI), Artificial Intelligence (AI), and Investment Decisions (ID) in the realm of financial decision-making. It investigates how human emotional intelligence directly influences investment choices and the mediating role of AI in this process. Through empirical analysis, it reveals that EI not only impacts ID directly but also indirectly through AI-mediated pathways. The study highlights the crucial role of emotional awareness in investor decision-making, amplified by AI's technological capabilities. It suggests that emotional intelligence significantly influences most investors' decisions and that AI plays a substantial role in the investment decision-making process. This nuanced understanding provides valuable insights for financial practitioners and policymakers, stressing the importance of integrating emotional and technological dimensions for navigating modern investment landscapes effectively.
name: bla-048
